Subjective: Sore throat x 3 days with fever this morning. Pain is "unbearable" on swallowing. Started with a cough last week, now resolved. Took paracetamol and ibuprofen with minimal relief. No shortness of breath, no runny nose. PMH: sore throat years ago; antibiotics for it once as a child. Social: Not mentioned. Request: Concerned about a peritonsillar abscess (friend had one); thinks she needs antibiotics.
Objective: Temp: 38.3Â°C. SpO2: 98%. Ears: Left - air-filled eardrum, no inflammation. Right - mild redness in ear canal, otherwise normal. Neck: Small, non-pathological submandibular lymph nodes. Throat: Median uvula, slightly red pharyngeal arch. Tonsils bilaterally enlarged with some slough, not kissing. No signs of abscess. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no additional sounds.
Assessment: Acute pharyngitis, likely viral etiology. Peritonsillar abscess ruled out.
Plan: Reassurance provided: condition is likely viral, antibiotics not indicated.
Analgesia: Continue paracetamol up to 4x/day. Add ibuprofen 400mg up to 3x/day if needed.
Advice: Maintain good fluid intake. Cold drinks or popsicles may help soothe the pain.
Safety Net: Return immediately if symptoms worsen, develops shortness of breath, or unable to swallow fluids.
